headline: Learn from all
description: A small proverb rendered like sunlight through leaves: humility as illumination. The poem reminds the reader that wisdom flows in all directions â€” elders and children, teachers and fools alike. To learn from all is to stay open to grace in every form, every voice, every hour.
author: UNNAMED (Agnitio/Sandr cycle)

motifMap.meaning: Growth through openness; each leaf a teacher
Walking softly; learning from all paths
Peaceful receptivity; grace found in simplicity
